result.execSummary:
All charges against JOSHUA JOHN NELSON in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. JOSHUA JOHN NELSON is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: to Dismiss- Filed by ADA Gay

9:20 AM Defendant JOSHUA JOHN NELSON in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for JOSHUA JOHN NELSON.  Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint in 22CF560. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

BOND COVERS 22CF270, 22CF271, & 22CF560
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia / syringes unless medically required.
Defendant shall not possess or consume illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
Defendant shall not go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess firearms / dangerous weapons.
Not to associate with anyone involved in illegal drug activities.

Court orders defendant to complete paperwork today.

Review hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
